description: manage user files for basic authentication

name.description: User name to add or remove

create.description: Used with C(state=present). If specified, the file will be created if it does not already exist. If set to "no", will fail if the file does not exist

state.description: Whether the user entry should be present or not

path.description: Path to the file that contains the usernames and passwords

password.description: Password associated with user. Must be specified if user does not exist yet.

crypt_scheme.description: Encryption scheme to be used.  As well as the four choices listed here, you can also use any other hash supported by passlib, such as md5_crypt and sha256_crypt, which are linux passwd hashes.  If you do so the password file will not be compatible with Apache or Nginx
